comments:
When using the help on the platform under Workbenchuserguide/gettingstarted/basictutorial/editorsandviews/editor the page does not display but give the following error message:

The content producer for this document encountered an internal error while processing the document.

gnu.xml.dom.DomDOMException: The node doesn't belong here.
More Information: document type already present: gnu.xml.dom.DomDoctype[html]
Node Name: html
   at gnu.xml.dom.DomDocument.checkNewChild(libgcj.so.7rh)
   at gnu.xml.dom.DomDocument.insertBefore(libgcj.so.7rh)
   at gnu.xml.transform.TransformerImpl.transform(libgcj.so.7rh)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.xhtml.UATransformManager.convertToString(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.xhtml.UATransformManager.getAsInputStream(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.DynamicContentProducer.openXHTMLFromPlugin(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.DynamicContentProducer.getInputStream(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.util.ResourceLocator.openFromProducer(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.protocols.HelpURLConnection.getInputStream(org.eclipse.help_3.2.1.R321_v20060920.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.servlet.EclipseConnector.transfer(servlets.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.servlet.ContentServlet.doGet(servlets.jar.so)
   at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(tomcat5-servlet-2.4-api-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(tomcat5-servlet-2.4-api-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.eclipse.tomcat.internal.EclipseErrorReportValve.invoke(tomcatwrapper.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(catalina-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(tomcat-http-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11BaseProtocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(tomcat-http-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.PoolTcpEndpoint.processSocket(tomcat-util-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.LeaderFollowerWorkerThread.runIt(tomcat-util-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(tomcat-util-5.5.17.jar.so)
   at java.lang.Thread.run(libgcj.so.7rh)

Not certain but this looks like a bug in your gnu dom implementation. Either way I've already rewritten this in 3.3 to not use DOM transformers so this should no longer happen in 3.3.

Recommend using one of the reference implementation JREs (Sun or IBM).
*** Bug 168662 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
